thread.title: Black Raiders net 10th win against host Lions
thread.title_full: Black Raiders net 10th win against host Lions

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Black Raiders net 10th win against host Lions
text:
Black Raiders net 10th win against host Lions Perkins, Kennedy notch goals for Belfast By Staff | Oct 15, 2015 
Belfast â€” The Belfast boys soccer team has had a rough go of it in 2015 in terms of wins and is running out the remainder of its season, including on Wednesday, Oct. 14 as it hosted perennial powerhouse Winslow in a Kennebec Valley Athletic Conference Class B South showdown. 
The Lions, who have earned only one win, could not keep pace with the potent Black Raider offense and dropped an 8-2 decision to the visitors. 
Leading the Winslow offense were Jake Houghton (2 goals), Jake Warn (2 goals), Noah Dugal (goal), David Selwood (goal), Jimmy Fowler (goal) and Cody Doughty (goal). 
Skylar Perkins had a goal and an assist for Belfast, while Sean Kennedy added one goal and Garrett Hamlin one assist for the hosts. 
Max Lewis made 14 saves on 25 shots in goal for Belfast, while Jake Lapierre made five saves on nine shots in net for Winslow. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Belfast (1-11, 6.7858 points) is 18th, while Ellsworth (10-1-1, 122.1684 points) is first in the 18-team region. The top 12 teams qualify for the playoffs.
